conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the metal rod MN and the resistance value of R2.
The metal rod MN is stationary, so the net force acting on it must be zero.
Component of the gravitational force along the incline must be balanced by the component of the Ampere force along the incline.
Gravitational force on the rod is F_g = mg = 0.17 N.
Component of the gravitational force along the incline is F_{g,parallel} = 0.085 N.
Component of the Ampere force along the incline must balance the gravitational component: F_{A,parallel} = F_A * 0.5.
Ampere force is given by F_A = BIL.
Total resistance in the circuit is R_1 + R_2 + r.
Using Ohm's law, calculate R_2: R_2 = 0.3 Ω.
Final answer: Ampere force is 0.17 N and resistance value of R_2 is 0.3 Ω.
